cons: Limited research group opportunities so fewer opportunities to conduct different kinds of research.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Butte, MT
pros: Very helpful advisors and mentors
cons: The pay is somewhat less

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Butte, MT
pros: The hours... I mean, obviously, the goal is to get work done but I was basically able to set my own work schedule. Very knowledgeable advisors, everyone is extremely helpful, and the financial assistance with tuition is a huge plus.
cons: The hours... when you have to get work done you've got to get it done. Pay isn't great but its a livable wage (you're a grad student... what do you expect?)

review_title: Dismally small wages but a nice town
pros: The surrounding area has plenty of places to go hiking, mountain biking, and fishing. Everyone is friendly for the most part. No one cares what ethnicity you are which is nice.
cons: Management is more concerned about covering up issues than solving them. Long sleeves are seldom wore in labs dealing with chemicals. I only have seen 2 people consistently wear lab coats. They pay is less than what other colleges pay for.

job_title: Montana Tech URP in Butte, MT
pros:
Great student opportunity.
Looks good on your resume.
Helps pay student bills!
cons:
Depends on your mentoring professor.
If your subject pick isnt your favorite, you might tired of all the research, and still have to present your findings.

review_title: Great place to work...need higher pay!
pros: Culture, family/work life, support, benefits
cons: Pay scale is minimal. Graduated with a Bachelors and am earning the same wages as someone without a degree. College suggests High ROI but that is for the Petroleum and Engineering students. The business students are lower end.

review_title: First year at work was alright, I just want to comment that they should increase pay every year.
pros:
1. Get to know more students around where you work at on campus.
2. Gain experiences and put them on the resume.
cons: 1. Needs to increase pay scale every other six months.

pros: As a student worker it is a great opportunity to gain experience in your field before heading out into said field.
cons: As a student worker you end up getting paid beans.  Although it is not minimum wage, it is still very low.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Butte, MT
pros: Lovely campus and friendly staff
cons: Job was quite demanding during end of semester as grades and reports had to be returned to students in a timely manner.

review_title: Our company works together like a family

review_title: Fairly good place to do research!
pros: Very friendly people, If matched with the right adviser you can do very well, especially comparing to the size of the school.
cons: Not a research oriented school..
